com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.cache

Interface BytesCache

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeLRUBytesCache

    public interface BytesCache
extends Closeable
    Interface defining a cache sitting on top of any byte array store associating long offsets with BytesSegment instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the cache.
      boolean get(long offset, BytesSegment target)
      Gets cached bytes for the given offset.
      void put(long offset, BytesSegment bytes)
      Caches bytes for the given offset.
      void remove(long offset)
      Removes a cache entry.
      void update(long oldOffset, long newOffset, BytesSegment bytes)
      Updates the cache by removing bytes associated with the given old offset and caching bytes for the given new offset.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • get

        boolean get(long offset,
            BytesSegment target)
        Gets cached bytes for the given offset.
        Parameters:
        offset - an offset
        target - the target BytesSegment
        Returns:
        true if the cache lookup was successful, false otherwise

      • put

        void put(long offset,
         BytesSegment bytes)
        Caches bytes for the given offset. Note that implementations do not have to guarantee to be idempotent when this method is invoked multiple times with the same arguments (which should not be required).
        Parameters:
        offset - an offset
        bytes - the associated bytes

      • update

        void update(long oldOffset,
            long newOffset,
            BytesSegment bytes)
        Updates the cache by removing bytes associated with the given old offset and caching bytes for the given new offset. Calling this method is conceptually equivalent to calling remove(oldOffset) then put(newOffset, bytes), but this composite method allows cache implementations to guarantee better performance. If the given old offset is not the offset of a cached entry, invoking this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        oldOffset - the old offset
        newOffset - the new offset
        bytes - the bytes associated with the new offset

      • remove

        void remove(long offset)
        Removes a cache entry.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset of the entry to remove

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the cache.
